intro: Humboldtia brunonis var. raktapushpa, commonly known as the red-flowered humboldtia, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant is notable for its striking red flowers, which bloom in clusters during the monsoon season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
